data.fullContent: The number of Loyalists in each colony varied. Recent estimates suggest that half the population of New York was Loyalist; it had an aristocratic culture and was occupied throughout the Revolution by the British. In the Carolinas, back-country farmers were Loyalist, whereas the Tidewater planters tended to support the Revolution.
data.answer: 每个殖民地效忠者的数量各不相同。最近的估计表明，纽约有一半人口是保皇派；它有贵族文化，在整个革命期间被英国人占领。在卡罗来纳，边远地区的农民是忠诚的，而沿海地区的种植园主则倾向于支持革命。
